AdditionalFields.Value: Immunology,Experimental and Molecular Therapeutics,Molecular/Cellular Biology and Genetics

Description: Acute lymphoblastic leukemia (ALL) is the most common pediatric cancer, and accounts for 20% of acute leukemias in adults. The pinnacle of modern oncology has been the implementation of multiagent cytotoxic chemotherapy to cure pediatric ALL. However, new approaches are needed to manage relapsed disease and ALL in older adults. In this session, we will discuss new insights into the pathogenesis of both B- and T-lineage ALL, and recent translational work focusing on novel therapeutics for high-risk subsets.
SearchResultBody: ED004. Understanding the Disease Biology of ALL: Insights from Genomic and Translational Studies
Title: Understanding the Disease Biology of ALL: Insights from Genomic and Translational Studies
